moves.1. e4 c5 2. b4: Left wing gambit - uncommon but good for white players who do not like the sicilian
moves.6... e5 7. c4: Challenging the queen, the aim is to get advance in developpement.
moves.7... Qe4+: Probably not a good move. It doesn't prevent white's developpement and the queen will quickly be under menace
moves.8... Nd4: Black carries on attacking, moving twice the same piece for the second time.
moves.9. Bxd4: Exchaning a piece that moved twice against a piece that moved once.
moves.9... exd4: Black is better on the center, has material advantage but is in late in developpement
moves.10. d3: To fire the queen, protect c4 and block d4
moves.10... Qf4: Black keeps his queen in white's territory, pressuring but dangerous.
moves.11... bxa3: Moving the same piece twice for the third time
moves.13. Nc2: menacing d4, it's white's next target
moves.13... Bc5: The following moves will all be aiming at d4, wether for attack or for defense
moves.15. Re1: I longly hesitated befor playing this move.
moves.16. Bf1: The bishop can come and protect the f knight and frees the e rook
moves.16... O-O 17. Ncxd4: If 17. ... Bxd4 18. Nxd4 Qxd4 Rxe7 and white wins the trading sequence
moves.18. Nc2: Lancelot is brave but not foolhardy. retreat is sometimes better.
moves.19. d4: Now that white has get rid of d4, he wants to conquier the center.
moves.20... Rad8: Pinning the knight to the queen
moves.21. Re4: Protecting the knight to keep the material advantage.
moves.21... Rxd4: Trading but white will conserve his advantage
moves.22. Nxd4 Rd8: The knight is still pinned but white has material advance
moves.23... Qe5: Only place if black wants to carry on pressuring the central knight.
moves.24. Ra5: Not dangerous, for white has material advantage and cn afford to trade a rook against a bishop.
moves.25. Rxa6: 25. Rxc5 was also available. But this move is very dangerous for black because it the black rook moves, 26. Ra8+ and there is mate in 3 moves...
moves.25... g5: ... So that black gives space for his king, menacing the rook.
moves.26. Nxe6:
! The game is finished, black is doomed and submits because the mate is unavoidable for
if 26. ... Rxd1 27. Ra8+ and black is mate in 3 moves.
if 26. ... Qxe6 or 26. ... fxe6 or 26. ... gxf4, 27. Qxd8+  with huge advantage for white and mate to follow.
